content.text: Make \(x\) the subject of the formula. \(y = \frac{x}{3} + 5\)
This Venn diagram shows the number of elements in each region
Write down the value of n \((A \cup B')\)
Helen measures a rectangular sheet of paper as 197 mm by 210 mm, each correct to the millimetre
Calculate the upper bound for the perimeter of the sheet of paper
The sketch shows the graph of \(y = ax^n\) where \(a\) and \(n\) are integers
Write down a possible value for \(a\) and a possible value for \(n\)
Calculate \(7.85 \div (2.366 \times 10^2)\), giving your answer in standard form
Write down all the steps in your working
Eva invests $120 at a rate of \(3\%\) per year **compound interest**
Calculate the total amount Eva has after 2 years
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
The cost of a cup of tea is \(t\) cents
The cost of a cup of coffee is \((t + 5)\) cents
The total cost of 7 cups of tea and 11 cups of coffee is 2215 cents
Find the cost of one cup of tea
The volume of a solid varies directly as the **cube** of its length
When the length is \(3\mathrm{cm}\), the volume is \(108\mathrm{cm}^3\)
Find the volume when the length is \(5\mathrm{cm}\)
Federico changed 400 euros (€) into New Zealand dollars (NZS) at a rate of €1 = NZ$ 2.1
He spent \(x\) New Zealand dollars and changed the rest back into euros at a rate of €1 = NZ$ \(d\)
Find an expression, in terms of \(x\) and \(d\), for the number of euros Federico received
The diagram shows the lines \(y = 1\), \(y = x + 4\) and \(y = 4 - x\)
On the diagram, **label the region** \(\mathbf{R}\) where \(y \geqslant 1\), \(y \geqslant x + 4\) and \(y \leqslant 4 - x\)
The diagram shows the straight line which passes through the points (0, 1) and (3, 13)
Find the equation of the straight line
A cylinder has a height of \(12\mathrm{cm}\) and a volume of \(920\mathrm{cm}^3\)
Calculate the radius of the base of the cylinder
Give your answer in its simplest form
The larger container has a capacity of \(1600 \text{ml}\)
Calculate the capacity of the smaller container
The diagrams show two mathematically similar containers
The larger container has a base with diameter \(9\mathrm{cm}\) and a height \(20\mathrm{cm}\)
The smaller container has a base with diameter \(d\) cm and a height \(10\mathrm{cm}\)
The actual distance between two cities is \(80\mathrm{km}\)
Calculate this distance on the map. Give your answer in centimetres
On the map a large forest has an area of \(6\mathrm{cm}^2\)
Calculate the actual area of the forest. Give your answer in square kilometres
The scale of a map is \(1:250 000.\)
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O.\)
\(VT\) is a diameter and \(ATB\) is a tangent to the circle at \(T.\)
\(U, V, W\) and \(X\) lie on the circle and angle \(VOU = 70^{\circ}\)
The diagram shows a pyramid with a square base \(ABCD\) of side \(6\mathrm{cm}\)
The height of the pyramid, \(PM,\) is \(4\mathrm{cm},\) where \(M\) is the centre of the base
Calculate the total surface area of the pyramid

LaTeX command found outside math mode

content.text: Calculate the total distance of the journey
Calculate the acceleration of the train during the first 4 minutes
A train journey takes one hour
The diagram shows the speed-time graph for this journey
